column1: #Text=This is the pytorch implementation of our work at ECCV2020 (Spotlight).
#Text=The repository mainly includes 3 parts: (1) Extract RoI feature; (2) Train and inference; and (3) Generate relation-aware trajectories.
#Text=Anaconda 3, python 3.6.5, pytorch 0.4.1 (Higher version is OK once feature is ready) and cuda >= 9.0.
#Text=For others libs, please refer to the file requirements.txt.
#Text=Please create an env for this project using anaconda3 (should install [anaconda](https://docs.anaconda.com/anaconda/install/linux/) first)
#Text=>pip install -r requirements.txt # Install the provided libs
#Text=>sh vRGV/lib/make.sh # Set the environment for detection, make sure you have nvcc
#Text=The folder ```ground_data``` should be at the same directory as ```vRGV```.
#Text=Please merge the downloaded vRGV folder with this repo.
#Text=Please download the videos [here](https://xdshang.github.io/docs/imagenet-vidvrd.html) and extract the frames into ground_data.
#Text=Because I dumped all the detected bboxes along with their features.
#Text=It can be greatly reduced by changing detect_frame.py to return the top-40 bboxes and save them with .npz file.)
#Text=You can use our provided model to verify the feature and environment:
#Text=/ground.sh 0 val # Output the relation-aware spatio-temporal attention
#Text=python generate_track_link.py # Generate relation-aware trajectories with Viterbi algorithm.
#Text=If you want to train the model from scratch.

#Text=Please apply a two-stage training scheme: 1) train a basic model without relation attendance, and 2) load the reconstruction part of the pre-trained model to learn the whole model (with the same lr_rate).
#Text=For implementation, please turn off/on ```[pretrain] in line 52 of ground.py```, and switch between ```line 6 & 7 in ground_relation.py```  for 1st & 2nd stage training respectively.
#Text=Also, you need to change the model files in ```line 69 & 70 of ground_relation.py``` to the best model obtained at the first stage for 2nd-stage training.
#Text=/ground.sh 0 train # Train the model with GPU id 0
#Text=The results maybe slightly different (+/-0.5%), For comparison, please follow the results reported in our paper.
#Text=  author={Xiao, Junbin and Shang, Xindi and Yang, Xun and Tang, Sheng and Chua, Tat-Seng},
